etymologies: late 19th century: from French téosinté, from Nahuatl teocintli, apparently from teo:tl ‘god’ + cintli ‘dried ear of maize’

definitions: a Mexican grass that is grown as fodder and is considered to be one of the parent plants of modern corn.

notes.text: Zea mays subsp. mexicana, family Gramineae

shortDefinitions: Mexican grass which is grown as fodder and is considered to be one of parent plants of modern maize
